moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 f5 3. Nxe5 Qf6 4. d4 d6 5:
I have done Nd8 in a past game which did not fair well for me.
Here I did Re8+ which seems like an aggressive move.  I have won all my past games doing this move.
Other options to consider include: Qe4+ and Nf6.

Engine analysis suggests Nge7 followed by: 12. dxc6+ bxc6 13. Qd4 Nd5 14. Nc3 Re8+ 15. Ne3 Nxe3 16. Bxe3 Qe6 17. Kf2 Qf5+ 18. Kg1 c5 19. Bb5+ Kc8
moves.12. Be3:
Exactly like my previous games white responds with 12. Be3.

Upon further calculations though Ne3 gives white an even better advantage.
moves.12... Qe4:
The Mistake: Qe4 13. dxc6+ bxc6 14. Nxa7 d5 15. Bd3 Qxg2 16. Nb6+ cxb6 17. Qxc6+ Ke7 18. Rf1 Qxh2 19. Qb7+ Bd7 20. Qxb6 Nf6

Although black is still at a disadvantage Qf6 13. dxc6+ bxc6 14. Nd4 d5 15. Na5 Rxe3+ 16. Qxe3 Bb4+ 17. c3 Bxa5 18. h3 Bh5 19. Ba6 c5 20. Bb5+ Kc8 21. Qe6+ Qxe6+ 22. Nxe6
gives a closer game.
moves.13. dxc6+ bxc6 14. Nxa7 d5:
Again I am following my old game lines.
… d5 15. Bd3 Qxg2 16. Nb6+ cxb6 17. Qxc6+ Ke7 18. Rf1 Nf6 19. Qc7+ Ke6 20. Nc6 Be7 21. Bxb6 Kf7 22. Nd4 is not very good looking for black.

Improvement: … Nf6 15. Bd3 Qxg2 16. Rf1 Qxh2 17. Nb6+ cxb6 18. Qxc6+ Ke7 19. Qc7+ Ke6 20. Bc4+ Ke5 21. Nc6+ Ke4 22. Bd3+ Kd5 23. Ne7+ Ke6 24. Bc4+ Ke5
moves.15. Bd3 Qxg2 16. Ne5+:
Still lines played from my previous games.  Here white makes the error:
16. Ne5+ Rxe5 17. Qxc6+ Ke7 18. Qxc7+ Ke6 19. Qb6+ Kf7 20. Rf1+ Nf6 21. Nc6 Re4 22. Rf2 Qh1+ 23. Bf1 Bf3 24. Qc7+ Kg8 25. Qb6

Best would be: 16. Nb6+ cxb6 17. Qxc6+ Ke7 18. Rf1 Nf6 19. Qc7+ Ke6 20. Nc6 Bc5 21. Qxg7 Rhf8 22. Rg1 Qxh2 23. Bxc5 bxc5 24. Rxg4 Nxg4 25. Qxg4+
moves.16... Rxe5 17. Qxc6+ Ke7 18. Qxc7+ Kf6:
Awful mistake by me.  ...Ke6 is a much safer location.
(19. Qb6+ Kf7 20. Rf1+ Nf6 21. Nc6 Re4 22. h3 Bh5 23. Rf2 Qg1+ 24. Bf1 Kg8 25. Qa7 d4)
moves.19. Rf1+ Ke6: The game is over.  Ke6 is checkmate in 3 moves by white.
